title: How to Kill the Brute at the End of Halo 2

steps.title: Preparation for this fight should be early on.
steps.content: Preparation for this fight should be early on. Before you meet Sergeant Johnson there is a room with several brutes and some prisoners you can free. Take the chief tin's brute shot.

steps.title: Grab a Banshee and escort Johnson to the temple near the start of the level.
steps.content: Grab a Banshee and escort Johnson to the temple near the start of the level.

steps.title: Defeat the brutes who come for you and go to the control room.
steps.content: Defeat the brutes who come for you and go to the control room.

steps.title: Once you reach Tartarus (the boss), Throw a "sticky" (plasma grenade) and stick it to one of his minions so that they all die.
steps.content: Once you reach Tartarus (the boss), Throw a "sticky" (plasma grenade) and stick it to one of his minions so that they all die. It is recommended that you grab the shotgun. The sword is also effective so switch for one from your elite allies.

steps.title: Dodge ALL of his attacks, and let your allies deal with him up close.
steps.content: Dodge ALL of his attacks, and let your allies deal with him up close. Johnson will continually snipe him with a beam rifle.

steps.title: Let Johnson snipe him, it will lower Tartarus's shield which leaves him vulnerable for a time.
steps.content: Let Johnson snipe him, it will lower Tartarus's shield which leaves him vulnerable for a time. This is the time to fire at him. Use whatever weapon you will, its risky to get close but the sword can take him down easier.

steps.title: Make sure you get a lock-on with the sword to deal the most damage.
steps.content: Make sure you get a lock-on with the sword to deal the most damage.

steps.title: Shooting him is also good for defeating him easily, stay on the platform with Johnson and snipe him for a while.
steps.content: Shooting him is also good for defeating him easily, stay on the platform with Johnson and snipe him for a while. Then jump down and get up close, always go for head shots.
